{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Theatre Nurse",
  "description": "St Ives Specialist Hospital is a multi-specialist hospital which opened in 1996.The hospital offers dedicated specialist services in all matters of women, children and family health, managed by a group of consultants in Obsterics &amp; Gynaecology, Paediatrics, Medicine &amp; Surgery. Our Mission is to provide an advanced competitive IVF and Fertility Service of international standard with a high pregnancy rate at an affordable cost to couples.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Theatre Nurse

Job Location:&nbsp;Akowonjo, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Prepare patients for surgical procedures and ensure they are positioned correctly.
	Sterilize, arrange, and manage surgical instruments and equipment before each operation.
	Maintain strict aseptic techniques and uphold infection control standards in the operating theatre.
	Assist surgeons and anaesthetists during procedures by handing instruments and anticipating their needs.
	Monitor and record patients&rsquo; vital signs throughout surgical procedures.
	Perform accurate counts of instruments, sponges, and sharps before, during, and after surgery.
	Support patients during post-operative recovery and assist in transferring them to the recovery room.
	Document surgical procedures, nursing interventions, and patient information accurately.
	Ensure the operating theatre is clean, organized, and fully stocked for each procedure.
	Collaborate with the surgical team and follow all hospital policies, safety guidelines, and regulatory standards.


Salary
N298,500 / Month.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;recruitment@stiveshealthcare.com&nbsp;using &quot;Theatre Nurse&quot; as the subject of the email.",
  "datePosted": "2025-11-20",
  "validThrough": "2025-12-02",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "St Ives Specialist Hospital"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",

      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

    "value": "190664"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 250000,
      "maxValue": 400000,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Theatre Nurse Job at St Ives Specialist Hospital




        
    

        
        St Ives Specialist Hospital is a multi-specialist hospital which opened in 1996.The hospital offers dedicated specialist services in all matters of women, children and family health, managed by a group of consultants in Obsterics & Gynaecology, Paediatrics, Medicine & Surgery. Our Mission is to provide an advanced competitive IVF and Fertility Service of international standard with a high pregnancy rate at an affordable cost to couples.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Theatre Nurse

Job Location: Akowonjo, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Prepare patients for surgical procedures and ensure they are positioned correctly.
	Sterilize, arrange, and manage surgical instruments and equipment before each operation.
	Maintain strict aseptic techniques and uphold infection control standards in the operating theatre.
	Assist surgeons and anaesthetists during procedures by handing instruments and anticipating their needs.
	Monitor and record patients’ vital signs throughout surgical procedures.
	Perform accurate counts of instruments, sponges, and sharps before, during, and after surgery.
	Support patients during post-operative recovery and assist in transferring them to the recovery room.
	Document surgical procedures, nursing interventions, and patient information accurately.
	Ensure the operating theatre is clean, organized, and fully stocked for each procedure.
	Collaborate with the surgical team and follow all hospital policies, safety guidelines, and regulatory standards.


Salary
N298,500 / Month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@stiveshealthcare.com using "Theatre Nurse" as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Technical Buyer",
  "description": "Oilserv Limited is a leading provider of integrated engineering, procurement, construction, installation &amp; commissioning (EPCIC) services and complementary solutions across the asset and program life cycle within the onshore, offshore and subsea market segments of the oil and gas sector. Oilserv Limited was incorporated in 1992 and commenced operations in 1995.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Technical Buyer

Job Location:&nbsp;Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	This position is responsible for supporting the MRO Lead in ensuring that Customer Requests are rapidly turned to purchase orders and is expected to manage multiple orders simultaneously, anticipating varying degrees of complexity and value. In addition, the role continues to own related purchase orders through to closeout and/ or renewal.


Job Details


	Process&nbsp;PR&#39;&nbsp;s&nbsp;as&nbsp;assigned,&nbsp;verify&nbsp;prices,&nbsp;ensure&nbsp;right&nbsp;specification&nbsp;is&nbsp;made,&nbsp;call&nbsp;for&nbsp;quotes,&nbsp;when&nbsp;necessary,&nbsp;analyze quotes&nbsp;and&nbsp;obtain&nbsp;all&nbsp;relevant&nbsp;approvals&nbsp;prior&nbsp;to&nbsp;order&nbsp;in&nbsp;SAP.
	Strategies&nbsp;to&nbsp;shorten&nbsp;processing&nbsp;time&nbsp;utilizing&nbsp;IPS&nbsp;and&nbsp;Frame-Price&nbsp;agreements.
	Develop&nbsp;Procurement&nbsp;plan&nbsp;that&nbsp;would&nbsp;help&nbsp;support&nbsp;effective&nbsp;execution&nbsp;of&nbsp;critical operations&nbsp;for&nbsp;proper&nbsp;management&nbsp;of&nbsp;lead&nbsp;time&nbsp;and&nbsp;cost&nbsp;effectiveness.
	Creation&nbsp;of&nbsp;Purchase&nbsp;orders&nbsp;on&nbsp;spare&nbsp;part&nbsp;on&nbsp;SAP,&nbsp;as&nbsp;required&nbsp;by Operations.
	Maintain&nbsp;execution&nbsp;tracking Sheet&nbsp;for&nbsp;every&nbsp;spare&nbsp;part&nbsp;and&nbsp;services&nbsp;requested.
	Follow&nbsp;up&nbsp;on&nbsp;suppliers&nbsp;for&nbsp;delivery of&nbsp;materials&nbsp;in&nbsp;accordance&nbsp;with&nbsp;agreed&nbsp;lead&nbsp;time.
	Constantly&nbsp;monitor&nbsp;market price&nbsp;of&nbsp;materials&nbsp;and&nbsp;services in&nbsp;order&nbsp;to&nbsp;facilitate&nbsp;efficient review&nbsp;of&nbsp;price.
	Work&nbsp;with&nbsp;various&nbsp;customers,&nbsp;and&nbsp;stakeholders within&nbsp;Oilserv&nbsp;Businesses&nbsp;&amp;&nbsp;Functions,&nbsp;to&nbsp;execute&nbsp;commercial work&nbsp;plans,&nbsp;assuring supply&nbsp;of&nbsp;products&nbsp;at&nbsp;market&nbsp;competitive terms&nbsp;and&nbsp;quality&nbsp;conditions, taking&nbsp;lead&nbsp;in testing&nbsp;and&nbsp;obtaining&nbsp;test&nbsp;results&nbsp;for tested&nbsp;products&nbsp;that&nbsp;require&nbsp;such.
	Ensure&nbsp;all&nbsp;commercial&nbsp;activityis&nbsp;fully&nbsp;aligned&nbsp;with&nbsp;the&nbsp;Oilserv&nbsp;commercial&nbsp;strategies&nbsp;and&nbsp;Tail&nbsp;spend&nbsp;principles.
	Deliver&nbsp;end-to-end&nbsp;cost&nbsp;savings&nbsp;method&nbsp;that&nbsp;will&nbsp;impact&nbsp;on&nbsp;Oilserv&nbsp;bottom line
	Sources for OEM representatives/Foreign vendors on specialized categories
	Categorizes vendors based on technical competences.&nbsp;
	Expedites purchase order to delivery.
	Evaluates vendors Performance and recommend sanctions.
	Ensures goods received notes are issued to suppliers.
	Ensures that suppliers invoices are processed.
	Follow up with foreign procurement to processing of form M, mile-stone payments and shipment.
	Sends monthly report on status of supplies/ and pending deliveries.
	Proficient in the use of excel.&nbsp;
	Collate&nbsp;generated&nbsp;procurement&nbsp;documents and&nbsp;adequately&nbsp;file&nbsp;them in&nbsp;a&nbsp;systematic&nbsp;manner&nbsp;that&nbsp;will&nbsp;permit&nbsp;easy&nbsp;traceability.
	Process requisitions from weekly&nbsp;GEP-SMART&nbsp;and&nbsp;run&nbsp;reports as necessary.


Requirements


	BSc / HND Management, Social Sciences/Engineering
	CIPS- Membership.


Benefits


	Great work culture and multiple opportunities for growth and self-development.
	18 days of annual leave, excluding federal public holidays.
	Health Insurance coverage.
	Monthly employer pension contribution.
	Communication Allowance
	Etc
",
  "datePosted": "2025-11-20",
  "validThrough": "2025-12-02",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Oilserv Limited"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Rivers (PH)",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "190663"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Technical Buyer Job at Oilserv Limited




        
    

        
        Oilserv Limited is a leading provider of integrated engineering, procurement, construction, installation & commissioning (EPCIC) services and complementary solutions across the asset and program life cycle within the onshore, offshore and subsea market segments of the oil and gas sector. Oilserv Limited was incorporated in 1992 and commenced operations in 1995.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Technical Buyer

Job Location: Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	This position is responsible for supporting the MRO Lead in ensuring that Customer Requests are rapidly turned to purchase orders and is expected to manage multiple orders simultaneously, anticipating varying degrees of complexity and value. In addition, the role continues to own related purchase orders through to closeout and/ or renewal.


Job Details


	Process PR' s as assigned, verify prices, ensure right specification is made, call for quotes, when necessary, analyze quotes and obtain all relevant approvals prior to order in SAP.
	Strategies to shorten processing time utilizing IPS and Frame-Price agreements.
	Develop Procurement plan that would help support effective execution of critical operations for proper management of lead time and cost effectiveness.
	Creation of Purchase orders on spare part on SAP, as required by Operations.
	Maintain execution tracking Sheet for every spare part and services requested.
	Follow up on suppliers for delivery of materials in accordance with agreed lead time.
	Constantly monitor market price of materials and services in order to facilitate efficient review of price.
	Work with various customers, and stakeholders within Oilserv Businesses & Functions, to execute commercial work plans, assuring supply of products at market competitive terms and quality conditions, taking lead in testing and obtaining test results for tested products that require such.
	Ensure all commercial activityis fully aligned with the Oilserv commercial strategies and Tail spend principles.
	Deliver end-to-end cost savings method that will impact on Oilserv bottom line
	Sources for OEM representatives/Foreign vendors on specialized categories
	Categorizes vendors based on technical competences. 
	Expedites purchase order to delivery.
	Evaluates vendors Performance and recommend sanctions.
	Ensures goods received notes are issued to suppliers.
	Ensures that suppliers invoices are processed.
	Follow up with foreign procurement to processing of form M, mile-stone payments and shipment.
	Sends monthly report on status of supplies/ and pending deliveries.
	Proficient in the use of excel. 
	Collate generated procurement documents and adequately file them in a systematic manner that will permit easy traceability.
	Process requisitions from weekly GEP-SMART and run reports as necessary.


Requirements


	BSc / HND Management, Social Sciences/Engineering
	CIPS- Membership.


Benefits


	Great work culture and multiple opportunities for growth and self-development.
	18 days of annual leave, excluding federal public holidays.
	Health Insurance coverage.
	Monthly employer pension contribution.
	Communication Allowance
	Etc
    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Sonographer / Radiographer",
  "description": "St. Ives Specialist Hospital is a multi-specialist hospital located in Lagos. Since its establishment in 1996, the hospital has been providing dedicated specialist services in women&#39;s, children&#39;s, and family health. The hospital is managed by a group of consultants in various fields, including Obstetrics &amp; Gynaecology, Paediatrics, and Medicine &amp; Surgery.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sonographer / Radiographer

Job Locations:&nbsp;Festac and Ikoyi, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Perform diagnostic imaging procedures, including X-rays, ultrasounds, and other modalities.
	Collaborate with radiologists, and other healthcare professionals to interpret and prepare imaging results.
	Perform a variety of diagnostic ultrasound examinations on patients, including abdominal, obstetrical, gynaecological, vascular, and other speciality areas as needed.
	Adhere to hospital policies, protocols, and radiography/sonography standards.
	Participate in quality improvement initiatives to optimize imaging services.
	Ensuring clear images for diagnostic purposes and making adjustments to the sonographic equipment when necessary.
	Monitoring and caring for patients to ensure their safety and comfort during the imaging procedures.
	Completing the appropriate documentation and maintaining patients&#39; histories and medical records.
	Assisting the healthcare teams during invasive procedures.
	Operate sonography equipment to record and produce images of the composition, shape and motion of organs, blood, tissues or bodily masses
	Select the correct equipment settings and adjust to get the best angles and sites
	Scan patient and observe screen to make sure the image is satisfactory and make equipment adjustments as needed
	Prepare patients for exams and observe during procedures to ensure their comfort and safety
	Determine the best images to include in your report, noting differences between pathological and healthy areas
	Follow safety policies as applicable, recognize potential issues and institute measures to prevent complications
	Practice sterile procedures and prevent cross contamination
	Maintain cleanliness and order of workstations, rooms and equipment
	Liaise with HOD and consultant in charge on case management, evaluation and treatment plan.
	Carry out procedures as granted and approved in clinical privilege document.
	Deal with patients constructively and honestly and manage their grievances.
	Keeping abreast of the latest medical information through continuous medical education, formal education and personal professional development.
	Facilitate and make clinical &amp; non-clinical presentations at hospital clinical meetings as assigned.
	Performing other applicable tasks and duties as assigned by the HOD and Consultant in charge.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess&nbsp;B.Sc Degree, PGD in Ultrasound with 5 years of relevant work experience.


Salary
N500,000 - N600,000 monthly.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV&nbsp;to:&nbsp;recruitment@stiveshealthcare.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Sonographer / Radiographer Job at St. Ives Specialist Hospital




        
    

        
        St. Ives Specialist Hospital is a multi-specialist hospital located in Lagos. Since its establishment in 1996, the hospital has been providing dedicated specialist services in women's, children's, and family health. The hospital is managed by a group of consultants in various fields, including Obstetrics & Gynaecology, Paediatrics, and Medicine & Surgery.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sonographer / Radiographer

Job Locations: Festac and Ikoyi, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Perform diagnostic imaging procedures, including X-rays, ultrasounds, and other modalities.
	Collaborate with radiologists, and other healthcare professionals to interpret and prepare imaging results.
	Perform a variety of diagnostic ultrasound examinations on patients, including abdominal, obstetrical, gynaecological, vascular, and other speciality areas as needed.
	Adhere to hospital policies, protocols, and radiography/sonography standards.
	Participate in quality improvement initiatives to optimize imaging services.
	Ensuring clear images for diagnostic purposes and making adjustments to the sonographic equipment when necessary.
	Monitoring and caring for patients to ensure their safety and comfort during the imaging procedures.
	Completing the appropriate documentation and maintaining patients' histories and medical records.
	Assisting the healthcare teams during invasive procedures.
	Operate sonography equipment to record and produce images of the composition, shape and motion of organs, blood, tissues or bodily masses
	Select the correct equipment settings and adjust to get the best angles and sites
	Scan patient and observe screen to make sure the image is satisfactory and make equipment adjustments as needed
	Prepare patients for exams and observe during procedures to ensure their comfort and safety
	Determine the best images to include in your report, noting differences between pathological and healthy areas
	Follow safety policies as applicable, recognize potential issues and institute measures to prevent complications
	Practice sterile procedures and prevent cross contamination
	Maintain cleanliness and order of workstations, rooms and equipment
	Liaise with HOD and consultant in charge on case management, evaluation and treatment plan.
	Carry out procedures as granted and approved in clinical privilege document.
	Deal with patients constructively and honestly and manage their grievances.
	Keeping abreast of the latest medical information through continuous medical education, formal education and personal professional development.
	Facilitate and make clinical & non-clinical presentations at hospital clinical meetings as assigned.
	Performing other applicable tasks and duties as assigned by the HOD and Consultant in charge.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess B.Sc Degree, PGD in Ultrasound with 5 years of relevant work experience.


Salary
N500,000 - N600,000 monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@stiveshealthcare.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Call Center Agent",
  "description": "Choice Talents NG is Nigeria&rsquo;s preferred talents management company. Our goal is to help build successful businesses through effective talent, resource and process management.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Call Center Agent

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Make outbound calls to prospective and existing customers.
	Present products/services clearly and convincingly to drive sales.
	Follow up on leads, inquiries, and previous conversations.
	Maintain accurate records of calls, sales, and customer information.
	Meet and exceed weekly/monthly sales targets.
	Provide feedback on customer needs, trends, and opportunities.
	Handle customer objections professionally and suggest suitable solutions.


Requirements


	HND / BSc Degree in any field
	2 years of proven experience in telesales, telemarketing, or any phone-based customer engagement role.
	Excellent communication and negotiation skills.
	Strong persuasive ability and confidence in speaking with customers.
	Ability to work with minimal supervision and meet targets.
	Basic computer skills and familiarity with CRM tools (added advantage).
	Ability to maintain a positive attitude and handle rejection.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;jobs@choicetalents.com.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Call Center Agent Job at Choice Talents NG




        
    

        
        Choice Talents NG is Nigeria’s preferred talents management company. Our goal is to help build successful businesses through effective talent, resource and process management.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Call Center Agent

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Make outbound calls to prospective and existing customers.
	Present products/services clearly and convincingly to drive sales.
	Follow up on leads, inquiries, and previous conversations.
	Maintain accurate records of calls, sales, and customer information.
	Meet and exceed weekly/monthly sales targets.
	Provide feedback on customer needs, trends, and opportunities.
	Handle customer objections professionally and suggest suitable solutions.


Requirements


	HND / BSc Degree in any field
	2 years of proven experience in telesales, telemarketing, or any phone-based customer engagement role.
	Excellent communication and negotiation skills.
	Strong persuasive ability and confidence in speaking with customers.
	Ability to work with minimal supervision and meet targets.
	Basic computer skills and familiarity with CRM tools (added advantage).
	Ability to maintain a positive attitude and handle rejection.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jobs@choicetalents.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Data Analyst",
  "description": "At UPDC FM Limited, we specialize in comprehensive management, maintenance, and sustainable power solutions tailored for residential, corporate, and commercial properties.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Data Analyst
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos Island (Marina), Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
Business Performance Analysis:


	Monitor and analyse operational and financial data across estates, client sites, and service contracts. &bull;
	Prepare regular performance dashboards and reports, highlighting trends, variances, and insights.
	Identify underperforming areas and recommend improvement strategies.


Data Collection &amp; Reporting:


	Develop and manage tools for collecting data from various departments
	Generate timely, accurate, and detailed reports on KPIs including revenue, cost per site, service efficiency, and customer satisfaction.
	Assist in preparing board and management reports with key metrics and strategic updates


Process Improvement &amp; Operational Efficiency:


	Map, evaluate, and analyse current business processes across FM operations
	Recommend automation opportunities or process re-engineering to improve workflow, reduce waste, and increase efficiency
	Work with relevant departments to implement improvements and track progress.


Budgeting &amp; Forecasting Support:


	Collaborate with finance to develop and monitor budget performance.
	Assist in forecasting income, expenses, and service costs based on trends and contract data.
	Track budget adherence and flag critical deviations.


Strategic Planning &amp; Project Support:


	Provide analytical support for business development initiatives and new service models.
	Support feasibility studies, market research, and competitive benchmarking for new projects or expansions.
	Develop business cases and financial models to evaluate ROI on initiatives.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor&#39;s Degree with 2 - 4 years of experience.

Data Analyst Job at UPDC FM Limited




        
    

        
        At UPDC FM Limited, we specialize in comprehensive management, maintenance, and sustainable power solutions tailored for residential, corporate, and commercial properties.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Data Analyst
Job Location: Lagos Island (Marina), Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
Business Performance Analysis:
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Monitor and analyse operational and financial data across estates, client sites, and service contracts. •
	Prepare regular performance dashboards and reports, highlighting trends, variances, and insights.
	Identify underperforming areas and recommend improvement strategies.


Data Collection & Reporting:


	Develop and manage tools for collecting data from various departments
	Generate timely, accurate, and detailed reports on KPIs including revenue, cost per site, service efficiency, and customer satisfaction.
	Assist in preparing board and management reports with key metrics and strategic updates


Process Improvement & Operational Efficiency:


	Map, evaluate, and analyse current business processes across FM operations
	Recommend automation opportunities or process re-engineering to improve workflow, reduce waste, and increase efficiency
	Work with relevant departments to implement improvements and track progress.


Budgeting & Forecasting Support:


	Collaborate with finance to develop and monitor budget performance.
	Assist in forecasting income, expenses, and service costs based on trends and contract data.
	Track budget adherence and flag critical deviations.


Strategic Planning & Project Support:


	Provide analytical support for business development initiatives and new service models.
	Support feasibility studies, market research, and competitive benchmarking for new projects or expansions.
	Develop business cases and financial models to evaluate ROI on initiatives.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree with 2 - 4 years of experience.
